ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about inflammation and homeostasis. I gained knowledge of different causes of inflammation, the physiological purposes of inflammation, and the pathological consequences of inflammation. I learned the similarities and differences between inflammation and homeostasis by looking at the circuit view of systems and also the stock and flow models of the systems.

This course helped me to get a grasp on the mechanisms and processes involved in inflammation. Dr. Medzhitov is a fantastic lecturer, and is very good at making complex biological concepts seem rather straightforward- he is a master of metaphors and many could learn from him when it comes to scientific communication.
This course was engaging, fun, and creative. The course lectures were very in-depth and the assigned reading material was also insightful.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The lectures were extremely informative and helpful. There could be more interactive activities throughout the course either through the lectures or through homework assignments.
My only complaint is that I wish I had a better idea of when the class was going to finish each week, since our end time was rather variable.
Response feedback could be more prompt.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes it greatly expanded my knowledge of the topics and was informative to my research.
Yes- I liked how this course was not high pressure, yet I still felt very interested in the material and learned a lot from Dr. Medzhitov.
Yes. This course is a fun and creative
